Case reference: 2014004274.CaseDesc: Frédéric Cormier was last seen on January 11, 2001, in the Vieux-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. Frédéric would pick up his son once a week, but he has had no contact since this date.

Case reference: 2014004707.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1986, Paul Leduc was going to the family cottage at Lake Duhamel in the Saint Jovite, Mont Tremblant area. He has not been seen since. His vehicle and personal belongings were found at the cottage. His canoe containing paddles and a life jacket was found adrift on the lake near the cottage.

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978 at his residence in Edson. Mr. Nodeland’s motorcycle and helmet were recovered approximately one month later in a remote area south west of Sundre, Alberta. Mr. Nodeland may have been seen on foot in the area a short time later however he was never located.

Case reference: 2005003199.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1990, an unidentified man was found near the Hydro Plant in the Niagara River. He had short fingernails with dirt embedded underneath them and callouses on his hands. His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Hair: Black, Shorter than collar length with dark bushy eyebrows
Scar: Left Index Finger, old scar at the base of the finger
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, small mole

Case reference: 2014005905.CaseDesc: Abraham Flett, was last seen around mid-August, 2012 in Thompson, Manitoba. He has not made contact with his family or his employer in Split Lake and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001414.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1967, Sarah Ovayuak was last seen as she fell into the Tuktoyaktuk Harbour while trying to board a Coast Guard vessel.

Case reference: 2014004126.CaseDesc: René Jacques was reported missing on July 16, 1988, by his friend whom he lived with in Piopolis. He had left his family's home in Piopolis to live with his friend on July 7, 1988. It was not the first time René had left the family residence, but he always came back after some time.

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses

Case reference: 2014005230.CaseDesc: On March 9, 2009, Daniel Moisan was last seen leaving a residence in Victoriaville to go to an acquaintance’s house. Daniel has not been seen since.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Orange, Brand: Harley Davidson

Case reference: 2017019146.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2017, Hélène Martineau was seen for the last time when she left her home in the Ste-Thérèse sector in Jonquière, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Grey, Blue, Merrel brand, walking shoe

Case reference: 2014001063.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1980, the remains of an adult male were found in the Fraser River near Mission, British Columbia. He had no teeth and probably wore dentures. He had two healed vertical scars on the abdomen below the navel and estimated to have died several months prior to discovery.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical scar from Umbilicus to sternum
Abdomen, Surgical scar in rectus area

Case reference: 2014004320.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, Alexandre Fortin was seen for the last time in a home situated on road 127 in Saint-Georges, Quebec. Over the course of the night, a fire completely destroyed the residence and Alexandre remains missing, despite search operations.

Case reference: 2014004087.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1996, James Withers was last seen at his family's residence.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2013000143.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2013, Delvin D'Arcy's wife contacted the Fraser Lake RCMP to report her husband as missing. She advised them that Delvin was staying in Fort Fraser while working in the area. Delvin had contacted her on a regular basis but she has not heard from him since Feb 13, 2013.  It is believed that Mr. D'Arcy may be traveling to Ontario but he has not been heard of or seen since.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Salt and pepper grey

Case reference: 2014002286.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1980, Guy Fortier was seen for the last time as he left his residence, without saying where he was going, in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Guy was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014004217.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1968, Bernice Redhead, her brother and their parents were on the back of a dogsled which was being led by their grandfather. The group was traveling on God's River when they broke through the ice. All passengers fell into the water.   The grandfather was able to pull everyone to safety with the exception of Bernice, who was taken away by the swift moving current of the river. Bernice has not been located.

Case reference: 2006011099.CaseDesc: Kenneth Richard Wolfe was working on Caribou Lake, (15 km north west of Armstrong, Ontario). On October 8, 1970, he left alone in a 16 foot steel boat to work on a dock. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Wolfe.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005006999.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1981, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 40 to 60 years, was recovered from the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. He was seen jumping from a Ferry Boat by witnesses on board. He was transferred to Toronto General Hospital where he died on August 7, 1981. Staining on his teeth suggests that he was a smoker.

Teeth: Visible Missing, All of his upper teeth are absent and he only has five anterior teeth in his lower jaw.
Shirt: Yellow, A dark yellow shirt with blue and red box stripes
Deformity: Left Leg, Left leg is shorter than his right leg and it is possible that he may have had to wear lifts
Nose, Appears to have been previously broken.
Scar: Left Leg, Scarring on his left outer thigh and lower leg, probable skin donor sites.
Pelvis, Scars on both inguinal (groin) areas, possibly from hernia repairs.

Case reference: 2014003567.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2001, Jocelyn Gadoury was seen for the last time when he left his home in Laval, Quebec to go to his garage in Saint-Eustache, Quebec. Jocelyn has not been seen or heard from since.

Sweater: White, T Shirt, With writing "PATRON DE ZAPET"

Case reference: 2014004211.CaseDesc: On August 24, 1987, Louis Haineault, 48 years old, was last seen heading out in a boat to fish on Cree Lake, north of Buffalo Narrows, SK. Searchers located his boat and fishing nets, however the boat was inoperable. Searches of the area failed to locate Mr. Haineault.

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2017061282.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1999, Andrew Fraser was seen for the last time near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014003937.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1990, Reynald Fortin was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. He was known to be despondent and to consume alcohol. Reynald left his apartment without his identification or money.

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.

Case reference: 2014002590.CaseDesc: On April 15, 2000, Merlin Labrie was seen for the last time as he left a gathering with friends in Levis, Quebec. Merlin was supposed to meet up with a friend, but he never did and has not been seen since.

Mark: Head, Multiple beauty marks on the face

Case reference: 2014005523.CaseDesc: In 1998, Chi Fong was seen for the last time by his mother in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014005512.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2010, Ivana Ferus was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario, to catch a flight destined for the Czech Republic. Ivana’s apartment keys were subsequently found in a recycling bin.

Case reference: 2012020063.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1966, Kimberley Mclean was seen for the last time in Whiteshell Provincial Park in Rennie, Manitoba. That day, Kimberley and her mother had attended Camp Alloway for a staff picnic.  Upon their arrival, Kimberley changed into her bathing suit and went to the dock area. Five minutes later, Kimberley's mother went down to the dock with some cookies for her daughter, but was unable to find her.

Case reference: 2021043326.CaseDesc: In the evening of September 20, 2021, Jeremiah Guthro was seen for the last time as he walked away from his residence in the Glebe neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014046601.CaseDesc: Jason Beaupit has not been in contact with his family since September 2014. Mr. Beaupit was last seen on October 19, 2014, at a shelter in downtown Edmonton. He is known to travel and camp throughout British Columbia and Alberta.

Case reference: 2020009578.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1989, at approximately 1:00am, Andrew Gunzinger was seen for the last time leaving his girlfriend’s father’s farm near Orangeville, Ontario. Prior to leaving, Andrew and his girlfriend had gotten into a dispute.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2012020037.CaseDesc: Mr. Old Shoes' last known whereabouts are that he was camping on the Blood Reserve Timber limits area located between Waterton Lakes National Park and the Chief Mountain Border Crossing. He was last seen on April 1, 2001.

Case reference: 2012020014.CaseDesc: Sharon Gayle Dawson was seen for the last time on Christmas day in 2010, when she left her home in Qualicum Beach on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. There is an unconfirmed report that she was seen on December 28, 2010 at the World Parrot Refuge near Coombs, B.C.

Case reference: 2008015599.CaseDesc: In late February 2006 William "Billy" Mason of Hamilton Ontario went missing. An extensive investigation has been conducted by the Hamilton Police Service but William Mason has not been seen or heard from since.  It is known that Billy Mason was murdered shortly after he went missing. The responsible person was convicted of his killing but Billy Mason's remains have not been recovered.

Case reference: 2019049184.CaseDesc: On September 6, 1973, the body of a well nourished man were found on East Hastings in Vancouver, British Columbia. He recently had cranial surgery due to a head injury and had several old scars on his scalp.  He had extensive scar tissue around his lungs, possibly due to smoking (emphysema) or multiple infections such as pneumonia or tuberculosis.

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2014004813.CaseDesc: Germain Gaudreault was seen for the last time on August 26, 2006, around noon in the area of the municipality of Baie Ste-Catherine, Quebec. He was alone in his 1997 white Plymouth on Highway 138 eastbound. His unoccupied vehicle was found later that evening on the wharf of the municipality of Les Escoumins.

Tattoo: Chest, Blue dot for medical treatments

Case reference: 2011001999.CaseDesc: Abdulatif Salman, age 25, suffers from schizophrenia. He left his home on Twyford Street,  on the evening of October 23, 2010 on foot, with no property, money or identification. He has not been heard from since.

Jacket: Grey, Blue, winter, has a hood

Case reference: 2014001045.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1976, the remains of a young adult male were found floating in the waters off Moresby Island, British Columbia. He was wearing jeans with a brown belt and had a long yellow rope tied around his waist.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2019059675.CaseDesc: On February 26, 1989, the body of an unidentified man was found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had an abdominal hernia, and poor dental hygiene. The results of the autopsy showed evidence of chronic alcohol abuse, and he was likely despondent prior to his death.

Pants: Dark Blue, Marks and Spencer brand
Suit: Black, Osman Brand, Warm up suit, X Large

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake. It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded. The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2019058725.CaseDesc: In the spring of 2019, Glenn Field was seen for the last time by a pilot flying over his campsite located at Rolfe Lake, Northwest Territories. Glenn had flown out to Rolfe Lake in September of 2018 with the intentions of spending the winter living on the land and making his way back to Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, in the Spring of 2019. Glenn had three dogs with him and food to last the winter. The RCMP Search and Rescue conducted an areal search of Rolfe Lake in October of 2019, but found no signs of Glenn.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004591.CaseDesc: In July 2004, Philip Leishman left his residence with a friend from Kakisa Lake, Northwest Territories. Philip had told his family that he would be travelling to Fort McMurray, Alberta, and it was confirmed that he was in Fort McMurray until late August of 2004. Philip has ties to Port Alberni, British Columbia, Grand Prairie, Alberta, and Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006024399.CaseDesc: Mark Cornett was last seen at Missinaibi Lake, 1.0 kilometre north of Fairy Point in Missinaibi Township. He was involved in a boating accident on his way back from fishing and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2013000101.CaseDesc: Oswald Bear left his parents home in Peguis First Nation, Manitoba to go to the bush a short distance east of the house and cut some wood. Mr. Bear was very familiar with the area and enjoyed chopping wood. He spent a lot of time there and knew it well. He had never been lost in the bush and had never failed to return home previously. He visited at his sister's residence nearby at 6:15 p.m. Shortly thereafter, his sister told him that he should go home so that their mother wouldn't worry. When Mr. Bear left his sisters's residence, his intention was to go home, but he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002565.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1975, Carl Gallen was employed as an iron worker on the Long Spruce dam project. He was working with his partner on a cement wall near the river. Mr. Gallen was drilling into the wall when he fell into the water. His partner indicated that Carl went directly under the water and that he did not see him surface. Mr. Gallen was not wearing either a safety belt or life jacket. It is presumed Mr. Gallen drowned.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2014002118.CaseDesc: Henry M’Lot was reported missing by his brother on November 13, 1973. At the time of his disappearance, he was despondent due to the separation with his wife.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Head, Burr hole from operation right front side of skull

Case reference: 2010005899.CaseDesc: Mark Edmonson disappeared from his residence in Stoney Creek on October 3, 1999. Mr. Edmonson has not returned or contacted his family members since that time and both his family and Police are concerned for his well being. Mr. Edmonson is developmentally challenged. It is believed that Mr. Edmonson left home without taking any money or personal identification. Extensive police searches have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Pants: Blue, Jeans with hole in left knee

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2014005133.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2008, Laventus Burke was seen for the last time in St. Albans, Newfoundland and Labrador. During the time of his disappearance, Laventus had left a note for his mother indicating that he was going to travel to Alberta for work, and then would be moving to the State of Florida in the United States.

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2012020659.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2012, at approximately 1:30 a.m., Brandy Wesadquate was seen for the last time leaving a house party in the 900 block of Rae Street in Regina, Saskatchewan. Since then, Brandy has not had any contact with her family or friends.

Jacket: White, Black, Zippered; Adidas brand, blue or black stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2019062090.CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2012020104.CaseDesc: On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Francis Albert-Cloutier was seen for the last time at his home located in Saint-Marc-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. His vehicle, a black 2001 Chrysler Intrepid was found on the following day by a passerby on an ATV trail in Saint-Amable, Quebec. No one has since seen or heard from Francis.

Jewelry: Gold, A ring with colored stone on each middle finger

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001130.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1972, the body of a young man was found in the Fraser River near Port Coquitlam, British Columbia. The pathologist described him as being “short and chubby” and noted that he had had extensive dental work. It is believed that he died several weeks before his remains were recovered.

Case reference: 2015011630.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2000, a man's body was recovered from the St. Lawrence River near Boucherville Islands by the nautical patrol team.

Boots: Leather, Brown, "Georgia Giant" brand, steel toe boots

Case reference: 2022006239.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1990, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Vincent Stack was seen for the last time by his family members leaving his residence in Buffalo, New York. Vincent’s vehicle was located abandon in a parking lot near Niagara Falls State Park in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Case reference: 2016061146.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1964, the body of what was described as a young male was recovered from Lake Erie, off the tip of Long Point, adjacent to the Township of South Walsingham, County Norfolk. His post-mortem weight was recorded at approximately 190 lbs. Due to decompositional changes and post-mortem injury, this may not be an accurate reflection of his living weight. His appendix was present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a minimum of 3 months.

Teeth: Amalgam fillings in some of his molars and a gold inlay in his lower right 2nd molar.
Bathing Suit: Brown, Tan, trunks with a black/dark blue stripe on each side (34" waist)

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017070923.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2017, Yoseph Birhanu-Baynesagn left his home in the middle of the night. The following day, Yoseph called his cousin from Union Station to let him know that he was coming for a visit. He never made it to his cousin's.

Case reference: 2014006767.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2014, Guo Ding was seen for the last time when he was discharged from the Mount Sinai Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006025299.CaseDesc: Eetu Vainonen has been missing from the Thunder Bay (Port Arthur) area since sometime during 1935 to 1936.

Case reference: 2012002099.CaseDesc: Kelly Coleman was last seen near Mac's Convenience on Mapleview Drive in Barrie, Ontario in August 2011.  Kelly suffers from health-related issues and has not had contact with her family or friends since January 3, 2012. They are concerned for her well-being and are requesting assistance from anyone who may have had any contact with her.

Case reference: 2014004348.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1998, Steven Mylan was last seen at his family residence in Mississauga Ontario.  It is believed that Steven might have been headed to New York, and or, Arizona State in the United States of America.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Waist length, Sheep lining

Case reference: 2014004923.CaseDesc: On July 24th, 1973, Robert Chaple was reported missing. He was last seen arriving home on July 11th in the early morning hours.

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2014005873.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2012, Mark Pearson left his residence in Coaticook, Quebec. Searches have led police to believe that Mr. Pearson could have possibly fallen in the Coaticook River near the intersection of Child and St. Paul East streets in Coaticook, Quebec. He was reported missing on September 7, 2012.

Sweater: Cotton, Blue, T-shirt with Puma on the front

Case reference: 2014005162.CaseDesc: Steve Messervie was seen for the last time on October 6, 2008 in Montreal.  Mr. Messervie had been in hospital, however his identity had not been confirmed through identification documents.  Mr. Messervie had been diagnosed as having amnesia prior to leaving the hospital.

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014005423.CaseDesc: On January 22, 1971, Maryse Chalette was seen for the last time when she went out for a walk at approximately 12:30 p.m., in the Joliette area in Quebec. Maryse was placed in foster care by the CHRDL Hospital.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2006022599.CaseDesc: Edwin Scherer was last seen while on a hunting trip at Cedar Point Lodge on Gordon Lake. He was on vacation at the time and was a resident of Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Shirt: Wool, White, Black, lumberjack style; dirty
Jewelry: Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, watch with 3 black stones
Gold, Blue, Ring, large blue stone
Vest: Brown, Orange, hunting vest with orange on the shoulders

Case reference: 2002005560.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1975, at approximately 8:30 p.m., Michelle Wedge returned to her residence, but left shortly afterwards. Her bicycle was later located at the intersection of John and Dominion Street, which was not far from her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014006290.CaseDesc: Roxanne Marie Isadore was reported missing by a family member on September 24, 2013.  She had been out of family contact since she moved to Edmonton from Valleyview in 2006. Her last confirmed whereabouts were in Edmonton, in June of 2008.  She was known to live in the area of, and to frequent, 118 Ave in the Beverly neighbourhood of Edmonton, AB.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2018016052.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2008, the RCMP attended the scene of a fire in a rural woodland area 25 kilometers north of Lac La Biche, Alberta, where they discovered the partially burned remains of an adult male.

Case reference: 2014003848.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1964, the Grand Rapids RCMP was advised that there were rumors that Harvey Hudson was two weeks over due in returning from a trip to Cedar Lake from Grand Rapids. After numerous inquiries it was discovered M. Hudson left The Pas Manitoba on October 20th and arrived at Cedar Lake Post.  When he reached Cedar Lake, M. Hudson was advised by a friend to wait for a boat from Easterville which was expected shortly. A witness who spoke to M. Hudson indicated that he first left on foot for Easterville but turned back. He then took a canoe and started off for Easterville using a piece of board as a paddle. It is believed that Mr. Hudson had little or no food, no rifle or other camping gear. Numerous land, air and water patrols were made with negative results.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)
Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent

Case reference: 2014002585.CaseDesc: Mario Levasseur was last seen leaving the family home on December 1, 1983, in Levis, Quebec.

Case reference: 2010000699.CaseDesc: William Ostertag last spoke to his brother on December 16, 1990.  He was reported missing when he failed to show up for his work Christmas party in North Bay.

Hair: Black, Short, Comb over, moustache, sideburns
Coat: May have been wearing a blue or grey coat

Case reference: 2014001558.CaseDesc: Mr. Cochrane was reported missing when his family expressed concern over his absence, as he had a history of memory loss and in the past ran into the bush and/or wandered off. An intensive land search was met with negative results. A set of footprints was found leading into the water of the river and an intensive operation involving drilling 10 holes through the ice in the area failed to turn up any evidence. The whereabouts of Mr. Cochrane remains unknown.

Teeth: 2 molars absent on upper right side
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Arm, Left arm in cast

Case reference: 2005001899.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1978, the body of this adult male was found floating in the St. Lawrence River, near Prescott. He is described as being possibly Caucasian. His weight at autopsy was 171 lbs. and his appendix was present. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of East Asian ancestry (note that this includes the Philippines).
